alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have ended over this area, but light to moderate rains will continue for the next hour. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches have fallen over this area from the thunderstorms, and additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch is still possible with the moderate rains. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Miami Gardens, Hallandale, Weston, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Dania Beach, Miami Lakes, Cooper City, Hialeah Gardens, Opa- Locka, West Park, Medley, Country Club, Palm Springs North and Miramar Parkway And University Drive. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
